result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Pretrial conference set for November 21st - insufficient address - unable to forward - return to sender.

2:02 PM Defendant Shamaj Michael Durand Williams in court.  Attorney Travis S Slattery in court for Shamaj Michael Durand Williams.  Attorney Brian Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued. 
Court informs the parties that if the Preliminary Hearing is contested that the parties will need to set this with the assigned Judge on a date other than the Preliminary Hearing dates. 

Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on November 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Shamaj Michael Durand Williams
Current: 3409 Harmony Ln., Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States  (Effective: 09-19-2022)
Prior: 1014 Park Ave, Racine, WI 53403

ADDED CONDITIONS OF BOND:
No contact with HLB, except for purposes of child care exchanges 
Reside with the Coach at the address as stated on the record
Turn all weapons into the Portage County Sheriff's Dept.

ORIGINAL CONDITIONS OF BOND:
No contact with H.B., S.W., or their residence or any place they temporarily occupy.
Do not possess any dangerous weapons.
Defendant is ordered to surrender any firearms to the sheriff.
Victim is to file a family safety plan if contact with the defendant is requested.

If safety plan is filed:
No violent or abusive contact.
No contact with the minor child, unless another adult is present.

1:52 PM Defendant Shamaj Michael Durand Williams appeared by video, in custody at the Waupaca County Jail.  Attorney Travis S Slattery in court for Shamaj Michael Durand Williams.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Robert Jambois appears on behalf of ADA Kelly A Cassidy for State of Wisconsin. 

Court calls the case.
The parties state their appearances.
This matter is on for a bond modification.

Court questions defendant and informs of the right to be present in the courtroom.
Defendant requests to appear via ZOOM and confirms that he can hear. 
Defendant understands that if there are hearing problems to let the court know.

Court reviews the case.
1:54 p.m.  Atty Slattery argues with regards to the cash bond in the amount of $2,500 that had been set.
ADA Jambois questions Atty Slattery with regards to the coach that the defendant would be staying with.
Atty Slattery states that his client would be able to post about $300 dollars in cash.
ADA Jambois does not object to the modification but would ask for conditions as stated on the record.
Atty Slattery makes statements to the No Contact.
Court makes statements to the parties.
H.L.B. had filed a family safety plan.
ADA Jambois states that there should be no contact, except for childcare.
Address updated:  3409 Harmony Ln., Stevens Point, WI  54481
Court questions ADA Jambois if he wishes to proceed to the Initial Appearance.
He does not as the victim notification has not been sent and he is to be in another Courtroom at this time.

BY THE COURT: 
Bond Modification is GRANTED.
Cash bond is amended to $300 cash with conditions as stated on the record.
Bail/bond hearing on October 7, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Bail/bond hearing on October 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Order Appointing an Attorney /s/ LJM 10/05/22 
Atty Travis Slattery appointed
**THE COURT MAY REQUIRE PARTIAL OR FULL REIMBURSEMENT AT THE RATE OF $100/HOUR**

Letter from the Defendant in re:  request for bond modification 
sent to Br 1 Judge/JA on 10/03/22 sp

CAP Services: Personalized Family Safety Plan filed by:  H.L.B.
I want contact with the defendant, but the Court ordered "No contact" or "No contact until further order of the Court".  I have completed the safety plan and I am filing this document to notify the Court that I would like to have contact with the defendant.

1:33 PM Defendant Shamaj Michael Williams appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Bergner appears on behalf of the defendant.

Assistant District Attorney (ADA) states facts for anticipated charges of criminal damage to property, disorderly conduct, and 
Attorney for the defendant does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Defendant is not eligible for public defender representation.
Court questions defendant. 
ADA Dodge notes that the State is in compliance with victim/witness legislation.

State requests a $5000 cash bond with conditions as stated. 

Attorney for the defendant objects to cash bond and states reasons on the record. 

BY THE COURT:
$2500 cash bond.
Hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

No contact with H.B., S.W., or their residence or any place they temporarily occupy.
Do not possess any dangerous weapons.
Defendant is ordered to surrender any firearms to the sheriff.

No violent or abusive contact.
